descript.abstract: Layer identifies the location of ports (seaports) throughout Grenada along with the number of ship calls, type of facility, and the infrastructure type. Data was obtained from the Grenada Ports Authority for all ports except the fuel terminal at Grand Mal. The data represent the time period 2009 - 2010.
descript.purpose: Developed to locate and visualize ports in Grenada. This information will help inform the Nature Conservancy's AWE project and the resilience of infrastructure during inundation events for Grenada. Scientists around the world agree that climate change is indisputable. Impacts, including rising sea levels, increased storm intensity, warming temperatures and acidifying waters, dying coral reefs, shifting fish stocks, and incidence of flooding and drought, are already being felt, and are expected to continue and increase for decades to come. Nature holds some of the world’s best and most practical solutions to climate change, solutions that keep nature and people healthy, safe, and secure. The goal of At the Water’s Edge (AWE) is to demonstrate that governments and people in vulnerable coastal communities in Grenada and St. Vincent and the Grenadines (SVG) can enhance their resilience to climate change by protecting, restoring and effectively managing their marine and coastal ecosystems (also known as ecosystem-based adaptation or EBA) and strengthening local capacity for adaptation.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Country Code 2 - 4 digit country identifier, same as calling code
Parish Code - Unique 2 digit parish identifier
Unique census enumeration district identifier consisting of 4 digit country code, and 6 digit key
Name of island where feature is located
Designates a terminal type to each feature.
Information on the type of infrastructure at each port such as pier or bouys.
Number of calls to the port for the time period listed in the "TIME_PER" field.
The time period for call to port number.
The telephone number of the port.
